heading: Integration by Parts Formula
summary: Use the formula ∫u dv = uv - ∫v du for integrating products of functions.

heading: Choosing u and dv
summary: Choose u and dv thoughtfully; follow the LIATE rule (Logarithmic, Inverse, Algebraic, Trigonometric, Exponential).

heading: Disk Method for Volume
summary: Volume V = π∫[f(x)]² dx for rotating around the x-axis; compute the integral from a to b.

heading: Washer Method for Volume
summary: Use V = π∫(R(x)² - r(x)²) dx for hollow shapes; R(x) is outer radius, r(x) is inner radius.

heading: Shell Method for Volume
summary: For rotation around y-axis, V = 2π∫x f(x) dx; x is radius, f(x) is height of the shell.

heading: Determining Limits of Integration
summary: Clearly identify limits of integration based on the region being revolved for accurate volume calculation.

heading: Example of Disk Method
summary: Volume of f(x)=x² from x=0 to x=2 around x-axis gives V=32π/5 after integration.

heading: Example of Washer Method
summary: Region between f(x)=x and g(x)=x² from x=0 to x=1 gives V=2π/15 using Washer Method.

heading: Example of Shell Method
summary: Rotating y=x² from x=0 to x=1 around y-axis gives V=π/2 with Shell Method.

heading: Practice is Key
summary: Practice different functions and methods to strengthen understanding of volumes of revolution.
